Let=E2=80=99s hope HTML code works in Yahoo groups.  I=E2=80=99m going to t=
ry to respond to your comments in brown text.   It should display where blu=
e text does.

From: mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
Sent: Wednesday=
, February 15, 2017 10:59 PM
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: =
RE: [archive-crawler] Some questions on what Heretrix can harvest

  

I ca=
n=E2=80=99t comment on the End of Term project as I am unaware what that is=
 but as far as Heritrix is concerned I can probably help you out there.


H=
eritirx can pretty much capture anything it=E2=80=99s delivering the conten=
t that may be an issue.

*** You referred to such an issue more than once. =
  Are you saying that Heritrix can back up the web content but it may not b=
e useful as far as anyone being able to publicly view or access it?   See m=
y explanation of what EDGI is below.

doc and xls isn=E2=80=99t an issue, w=
e have captured a lot of document like files with our Heritrix setup.

I am=
 unaware of any format that can=E2=80=99t be harvested.


=E2=80=9CCan Here=
trix harvest You Tube videos?   (there are usually direct links to view You=
 Tube videos, but you need a tool that then presents a list of options to d=
ownload.)=E2=80=9D


Youtube will be an issue as they try to stop people fr=
om harvesting their content. Heritrix will probably be able to capture it b=
ut Wayback may struggle to display the capture. Some organisations have pre=
tty good success capturing YouTube via Heritrix but it=E2=80=99s not as sim=
ple as your average capture.


=E2=80=9CWhat can be harvested from web page=
s that contain javascript?    I gather that Heretrix can=E2=80=99t follow l=
inks that are contained in or linked by javascript?   Can they be harvested=
 if they are linked by javascript and are contained in a local folder, as d=
istinct from a different web site?=E2=80=9D


Heritrix does attempt to find=
 links within javascript code and crawl them. This just comes down to how t=
he javascript is written and if Hertirix can parse it. Browser emulation do=
es help quite a bit here though. Something like Ubmra that ArchiveIT uses w=
ill make capturing URIs from within javascript much more successful.

*** D=
id you mean Umbra?    Right now it seems that our own people are independen=
tly coming up with ways to harvest each =E2=80=9Cuncrawlable=E2=80=9D web p=
age.   

I=E2=80=99m planning on learning the basics of javascript.   Even =
as a seeder I seem to need this knowledge to intelligently decide if web si=
tes are crawlable and which of our categories of uncrawlable they aren=E2=
=80=99t.   Can you maybe provide some clues that will make more sense after=
 I read the books, what about how javascript is written might make it easie=
r or harder for Heritrix to parse?    Such knowledge would be very helpful =
to all of our people.    Also, anything you can tell me will make immediate=
 sense to the coders, the people who are actually harvesting the web pages =
that have been identified as uncrawlable.  They know javascript.   On my ci=
ty=E2=80=99s team, the =E2=80=9Cresearchers=E2=80=9D, who check how sites w=
ere identified and then help the coders, are required to also know javascri=
pt.   They consider anyone who doesn=E2=80=99t incompetent to follow a web =
page.   


Can videos be harvested if there are direct links to them, and u=
nder what circumstances?

Yes, we generally don=E2=80=99t have any issue do=
ing this.


Can gifs that contain multiple slides be harvested, like gifs t=
hat play a series of images?

Yes, that will work fine.


All of this matte=
rs because I=E2=80=99m working on EDGI=E2=80=99s project, they don=E2=80=99=
t have or can=E2=80=99t provide complete instructions, and since they are h=
arvesting uncrawlable web sites that can not be submitted to the End of Ter=
m project, as a seeder, I need to know whether the page is =E2=80=9Ccrawlab=
le=E2=80=9D.    


=E2=80=9CCrawlable=E2=80=9D means that Heretrix can harv=
est the page and whatever the links reach, not that a search engine could c=
rawl it.   They may or may not have the same capacities.


This confuses me=
 somewhat. I don=E2=80=99t know what EDGI=E2=80=99s project is but I don=E2=
=80=99t know how something could be =E2=80=9Cuncrawlable=E2=80=9D unless th=
e page you are trying to capture isn=E2=80=99t visible by the Heritrix serv=
er. If you can link to it, you can crawl it. The exception here may be page=
s that you can=E2=80=99t view without some kind of user emulation but there=
 are still plenty of ways to get around this.

There are several groups wor=
king on efforts to save scientifically important federal web pages and data=
 that are especially potentially vulnerable to the new Administration=E2=80=
=99s views on certain issues like the environment and climate change.   EDG=
I is working with the End of Term project.    The End of Term project routi=
nely archives federal web sites just before and after every Presidential el=
ection, and has done so for I think about 12 years.   One of the two organi=
zations behind the End of Term project is the Internet Archive/ Way Back Ma=
chine.   

One can also nominate web sites for nomination by the Internet A=
rchive, and their explanation of what they can archive is also very vague. =
  

Is there anything more specific I can read about what the Heritrix does=
 and how it works?   The fact that I didn=E2=80=99t find it doesn=E2=80=99t=
 necessarily mean it isn=E2=80=99t there.   I sure can=E2=80=99t be the fir=
st person who asked!

EDGI was until a couple of weeks ago composed of a sm=
all number of people with extraordinarily busy professional lives who organ=
ized meetings where people sat around on laptops harvesting web pages and d=
ata.   The leaders are university librarians and archivists, and they=E2=80=
=99ve got a well organized scheme of organizing the work.  However they wer=
en=E2=80=99t prepared for the sudden influx of people trying to help.   

L=
ike the End of Term project and the Way Back Machine, EDGI has as its goal,=
 making web pages and data as they existed under the Obama administration, =
publicly available.    To accomplish this, it is necessary to be able to cr=
awl a link, capture it, and display it to the public.   From our perspectiv=
e if any part of that can=E2=80=99t be done with a web site as it is, it is=
 =E2=80=9Cuncrawlable=E2=80=9D.   

Each team has coders whose job is to do=
 whatever it takes to capture =E2=80=9Cuncrawlable=E2=80=9D web pages and d=
ata.   They do a considerable amount of script writing.  I=E2=80=99m not on=
e of them and don=E2=80=99t know if they are aware of the tools you have me=
ntioned, and I=E2=80=99ll pass them on.   

Two of the categories of uncraw=
lable web sites are links embedded in javascript, and interactive visualiza=
tions, as well as videos one can=E2=80=99t directly download, like You Tube=
.   

One thing I forgot to ask.   Does Heritrix have any special problems =
with php, and if so, what?   Something a coder told me suggests that, but t=
he only thing that he told me is that I would need to know php to be a =E2=
=80=9Cresearcher=E2=80=9D whose role is to help the coders.   If I hadn=E2=
=80=99t heard that, it wouldn=E2=80=99t have occurred to me not to mark pag=
es with a .php extension as crawlable, unless something about the content o=
f the page, such as interactive features, or the way the links are coded to=
ld me the page isn=E2=80=99t crawlable.   Since I=E2=80=99ve usually seen t=
he php extension on assorted pages that would jump out at me as uncrawlable=
 as I=E2=80=99ve been given to understand what is crawlable,  it is possibl=
e that is why.   For our purposes a page is crawlable if it is not interact=
ive and if one will always reliably get to the same url.   On all of the go=
vernment web pages that present information pertinent to environmental prot=
ection, air pollution, and climate change, interactive content displays dif=
ferent information, or even links, depending on what the user enters.   I t=
ried using wget to harvest some pages, and nothing at all appeared in the p=
laceholders for all interactive content.   

Does the heretrix that one can=
 download and use, work the same way as the Heretrix server?    If so perha=
ps I could experiment with it.   

Thanks!

Yours,

Dora Smith




Bradley =
Finn
Systems Support and Development Officer | Digital Integration and Supp=
ort | LINC Tasmania

91 Murray St, Hobart, Tasmania 7000
Ph (03) 616 55526 =
| bradley.finn@...
www.linc.tas.gov.au




From: archive-c=
rawler@yahoogroups.com [mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] 
Sent: Thur=
sday, 16 February 2017 3:35 PM
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject:=
 [archive-crawler] Some questions on what Heretrix can harvest


  

I have=
 some questions about what kind of web sites Heretrix can harvest.  None of=
 the discussions I can find are all that specific.  


First, and most impo=
rtant, I want to confirm that the End of Term project uses Heretrix, so tha=
t what the End of Term nomination form can get is what Heretrix can get?   =



Does Internet Archive also use Heretrix?


My actual concern is knowing =
what kinds of pages/ data can be sent to the End of Term project and Intern=
et Archive to be preserved.


I understand that both efforts can harvest pa=
ges that are =E2=80=9Cuncrawlable=E2=80=9D but not altogether clear what th=
at means.


There is no comprehensive list of what file formats can be harv=
ested.


Can doc and xls files linked from web pages be harvested?   Could =
I please have a list of preferably what formats can be harvested, or else a=
 list of what can=E2=80=99t.   


Can videos be harvested if there are dire=
ct links to them, and under what circumstances?


Can Heretrix harvest You =
Tube videos?   (there are usually direct links to view You Tube videos, but=
 you need a tool that then presents a list of options to download.)


What =
can be harvested from web pages that contain javascript?    I gather that H=
eretrix can=E2=80=99t follow links that are contained in or linked by javas=
cript?   Can they be harvested if they are linked by javascript and are con=
tained in a local folder, as distinct from a different web site?   


Can p=
ages be harvested if images, such as jpg, on them are loaded by javascript =
from a local folder?    What I=E2=80=99m told about that is outright contra=
dictory.   


Can gifs that contain multiple slides be harvested, like gifs=
 that play a series of images?


All of this matters because I=E2=80=99m wo=
rking on EDGI=E2=80=99s project, they don=E2=80=99t have or can=E2=80=99t p=
rovide complete instructions, and since they are harvesting uncrawlable web=
 sites that can not be submitted to the End of Term project, as a seeder, I=
 need to know whether the page is =E2=80=9Ccrawlable=E2=80=9D.    


=E2=80=
=9CCrawlable=E2=80=9D means that Heretrix can harvest the page and whatever=
 the links reach, not that a search engine could crawl it.   They may or ma=
y not have the same capacities.


Thanks a lot!


Yours,

Dora Smith

will be an issue as they try to stop people from harvesting their c=
ontent. 
Heritrix will probably be able to capture it but Wayback may strug=
gle to display 
the capture. Some organisations have pretty good success ca=
pturing YouTube via 
Heritrix but it=E2=80=99s not as simple as your averag=
e capture.<O></O></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE=
: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'><O></O></SPAN></=
P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Cali=
bri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'>=E2=80=9C</SPAN><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-FAMIL=
Y: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: black'>What can be harvested 
from web page=
s that contain javascript?    I gather that Heretrix 
can=E2=
=80=99t follow links that are contained in or linked by javascript? &n=
bsp; 
Can they be harvested if they are linked by javascript and are contai=
ned in a 
local folder, as distinct from a different web site?=E2=80=9D<O><=
/O></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-F=
AMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'><O></O></SPAN></P>
<P class=3D=
MsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-seri=
f; COLOR: #1f497d'>Heritrix 
does attempt to find links within javascript c=
ode and crawl them. This just 
comes down to how the javascript is written =
and if Hertirix can parse it. 
Browser emulation does help quite a bit here=
 though. Something like Ubmra that 
ArchiveIT uses will make capturing URIs=
 from within javascript much more 
successful.</SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNor=
mal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COL=
OR: #1f497d'><FONT 
color=3D#9e7c7c><U>*** Did you mean Umbra?  &=
nbsp; Right now it seems 
that our own people are independently coming up w=
ith ways to harvest each 
=E2=80=9Cuncrawlable=E2=80=9D web page. &nbs=
p; </U></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><U><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE=
: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'><FONT 
color=3D#=
9e7c7c>I=E2=80=99m planning on learning the basics of javascript. &nbs=
p; 
Even as a seeder I seem to need this knowledge to intelligently decide =
if web 
sites are crawlable and which of our categories of uncrawlable they=
 
aren=E2=80=99t.   Can you maybe provide some clues that will ma=
ke more sense 
after I read the books, what about how javascript is written=
 might make it 
easier or harder for Heritrix to parse?    S=
uch knowledge would 
be very helpful to all of our people.  &nbsp=
; Also, anything you can 
tell me will make immediate sense to the coders, =
the people who are actually 
harvesting the web pages that have been identi=
fied as uncrawlable.  They 
know javascript.   On my city=E2=
=80=99s </FONT></SPAN><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibr=
i",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'><FONT 
color=3D#00ff00><FONT color=3D#9e7c7c=
>team, the =E2=80=9Cresearchers=E2=80=9D, who check how sites 
were identif=
ied and then help the coders, are required to also know 
javascript. &=
nbsp; They consider anyone who doesn=E2=80=99t incompetent to follow a 
web=
 page.</FONT>   <O></O></FONT></SPAN></U></P>
<P class=3DMsoNorma=
l><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR=
: #1f497d'><O></O></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-FAM=
ILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: black'>Can videos be harvested 
if there =
are direct links to them, and under what 
circumstances?<O></O></SPAN></P>
=
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri=
",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'>Yes, 
we generally don=E2=80=99t have any iss=
ue doing this.<O></O></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-=
SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'><O></O></SPA=
N></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-ser=
if; COLOR: black'>Can gifs that contain 
multiple slides be harvested, like=
 gifs that play a series of 
images?<O></O></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal=
><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR:=
 #1f497d'>Yes, 
that will work fine.<O></O></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal=
><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR:=
 #1f497d'><O></O></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-FAMI=
LY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: black'>All of this matters 
because I=E2=
=80=99m working on EDGI=E2=80=99s project, they don=E2=80=99t have or can=
=E2=80=99t provide complete 
instructions, and since they are harvesting un=
crawlable web sites that can not 
be submitted to the End of Term project, =
as a seeder, I need to know whether the 
page is =E2=80=9Ccrawlable=E2=80=
=9D.    <O></O></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=
=3D'FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: black'><O></O></SPAN></P>
<P =
class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR:=
 black'>=E2=80=9CCrawlable=E2=80=9D means that 
Heretrix can harvest the pa=
ge and whatever the links reach, not that a search 
engine could crawl it.&=
nbsp;  They may or may not have the same 
capacities.<O></O></SPAN></P=
>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calib=
ri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'><O></O></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SP=
AN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f=
497d'>This 
confuses me somewhat. I don=E2=80=99t know what EDGI=E2=80=99s =
project is but I don=E2=80=99t know how 
something could be =E2=80=9Cuncraw=
lable=E2=80=9D unless the page you are trying to capture isn=E2=80=99t 
vis=
ible by the Heritrix server. If you can link to it, you can crawl it. The 
=
exception here may be pages that you can=E2=80=99t view without some kind o=
f user 
emulation but there are still plenty of ways to get around this.</S=
PAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY:=
 "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'><FONT 
color=3D#9e7c7c><U>There are =
several groups working on efforts to save 
scientifically important federal=
 web pages and data that are especially 
potentially vulnerable to the new =
Administration=E2=80=99s views on certain issues like 
the environment and =
climate change.   EDGI is working with the End of 
Term project.&=
nbsp;   The End of Term project routinely archives 
federal web s=
ites just before and after every Presidential election, and has 
done so fo=
r I think about 12 years.   One of the two organizations 
behind =
the End of Term project is the Internet Archive/ Way Back 
Machine. &n=
bsp; </U></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE:=
 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'><FONT 
color=3D#9=
e7c7c><U>One can also nominate web sites for nomination by the Internet 
Ar=
chive, and their explanation of what they can archive is also very 
vague.&=
nbsp;  </U></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FON=
T-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'><FONT 
col=
or=3D#9e7c7c><U>Is there anything more specific I can read about what the 
=
Heritrix does and how it works?   The fact that I didn=E2=80=99t =
find it 
doesn=E2=80=99t necessarily mean it isn=E2=80=99t there. &nbs=
p; I sure can=E2=80=99t be the first 
person who asked!</U></FONT></SPAN></=
P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Cali=
bri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'><FONT 
color=3D#9e7c7c><U>EDGI was until a=
 couple of weeks ago composed of a small number 
of people with extraordina=
rily busy professional lives who organized meetings 
where people sat aroun=
d on laptops harvesting web pages and data.   
The leaders are un=
iversity librarians and archivists, and they=E2=80=99ve got a well 
organiz=
ed scheme of organizing the work.  However they weren=E2=80=99t prepar=
ed for 
the sudden influx of people trying to help.   </U></FONT>=
</SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMI=
LY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'><FONT 
color=3D#9e7c7c><U>Like th=
e End of Term project and the Way Back Machine, EDGI has 
as its goal, maki=
ng web pages and data as they existed under the Obama 
administration, publ=
icly available.    To accomplish this, it is 
necessary to b=
e able to crawl a link, capture it, and display it to the 
public. &nb=
sp; From our perspective if any part of that can=E2=80=99t be done with 
a =
web site as it is, it is =E2=80=9Cuncrawlable=E2=80=9D.   </U></F=
ONT></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-=
FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'><FONT 
color=3D#9e7c7c><U>Eac=
h team has coders whose job is to do whatever it takes to 
capture =E2=80=
=9Cuncrawlable=E2=80=9D web pages and data.   They do a considera=
ble 
amount of script writing.  I=E2=80=99m not one of them and don=E2=
=80=99t know if they are 
aware of the tools you have mentioned, and I=E2=
=80=99ll pass them on.   
</U></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNo=
rmal><SPAN 
style=3D'FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; CO=
LOR: #1f497d'><FONT 
color=3D#9e7c7c><U>Two of the categories of uncrawlabl=
e web sites are links 
embedded in javascript, and interactive visualizatio=
ns, as well as videos one 
can=E2=80=99t directly download, like You Tube.&=
nbsp;  </U></FONT></SPAN></P>
<P class=3DMsoNormal><SPAN 
style=3D'FON=
T-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: "Calibri",sans-serif; COLOR: #1f497d'><FONT 
col=
or=3D#9b00d3><U>One thing I forgot to ask.   Does Heritrix have a=
ny 
special problems with php, and if so, what?   Something a cod=
er told 
me suggests that, but the only thing that he told me is that I wou=
ld need to 
know php to be a =E2=80=9Cresearcher=E2=80=9D whose role is to =
help the coders.   If I 
hadn=E2=80=99t heard that, it wouldn=E2=
=80=99t have occurred to me not to mark pages with a .php 
extension as cra=
wlable, unless something about the content of the page, such as 
interactiv=
e features, or the way the links are coded told me the page isn=E2=80=99t 
=
crawlable.   Since I=E2=80=99ve usually seen the php extension on=
 assorted 
pages that would jump out at me as uncrawlable as I=E2=80=99ve b=
een given to understand 
what is crawlable,  it is possible that is wh=
y.   For our 
purposes a page is crawlable if it is not interacti=
ve and if one will always 
reliably get to the same url.   On all=
 of the government web pages 
that present information pertinent to environ=
mental protection, air pollution, 
and climate change, interactive content =
displays different information, or even 
links, depending on what the user =
enters.   I tried using wget to 
harvest some pages, and nothing =
at all appeared in the placeholders for all 
interactive content. &nbs=
p; </U></FONT></SPAN></P>

0d3><U>Does the heretrix that one can download and use, work the same

with it.</U>   </FONT></SPAN></P>

ri",sans-serif; COLOR: black'>What can be harvested

ollow links that are contained in or linked by javascript?

st=
